README: Add note on project maintenance

note.body:
@lkundrak thank you for your work. I regularly use NetworkManager-fortisslvpn for my VPN connections to my workplace and it works for me, no performance issues. 

The problem I was trying to address at the time of the MRs is the different ways in which 2FA/OTP are being transmitted (email, SMS, app, etc.) though I barely remember my MRs now and possibly they have to be changed to fit whatever development has been made, here and in fortisslvpn. (At the time I also patched the KDE plasma applet, which is the environment I normally use.)  There still seem to be problems, to judge from the issues raised.

It is true that OpenConnect can handle forti's VPNs but I find fortisslvpn more focused. I have tested and used both and I have noticed no difference in performance for regular RDP sessions. I can try and test performance with file transfer and such if there is interest.

I can certainly do testing if development resumes, with some limitations because my day job will not allow me to spend a large amount of time here. Let's hope that others also chime in.

target_title: service: handle new hints for otp/2fa requests

NM-fortisslvpn adds duplicate routes and also adds routes for the vpn gateway to go through the vpn itself.

note.body:
I can confirm this same very discomfortable bug in distro Fedora Core 40.

Without VPN:
```
~# ip ro
default via 192.168.52.120 dev wlo1 proto dhcp src 192.168.52.23 metric 600 
192.168.52.0/24 dev wlo1 proto kernel scope link src 192.168.52.23 metric 600 
```

VPN successfully connected, but traffic doesn't work:
```
~# ip ro
default dev ppp0 proto static scope link metric 50 
default via 192.168.52.120 dev wlo1 proto dhcp src 192.168.52.23 metric 600 
$VPN_GW dev ppp0 proto kernel scope link src 192.168.2.6 
$VPN_GW via 192.168.52.120 dev wlo1 proto static metric 50 
$VPN_GW dev ppp0 proto kernel scope link src 192.168.2.6 metric 50 
192.168.52.0/24 dev wlo1 proto kernel scope link src 192.168.52.23 metric 600 
192.168.52.120 dev wlo1 proto static scope link metric 50 
```
The **TWO** lines on 3rd and 5th line is extra and shouldn't be there.


After this -> delete **BOTH** routes I can work via VPN:
```
~# ip ro del $VPN_GW dev ppp0
~# ip ro del $VPN_GW dev ppp0
```


Versions:

```
dnf list installed | grep forti
NetworkManager-fortisslvpn.x86_64                    1.4.1-5.20231021gite201da5.fc40     @fedora                                         
NetworkManager-fortisslvpn-gnome.x86_64              1.4.1-5.20231021gite201da5.fc40     @fedora                                         
openfortivpn.x86_64                                  1.21.0-4.fc40                       @fedora                                         
```

```
cat /etc/os-release 
NAME="Fedora Linux"
VERSION="40 (Workstation Edition)"
```
To clarify, I don't know who uses external mode. That's why I'd be wary about disabling it.
What does this accomplish? AFAICT, the auth dialog still supports external mode even after your changes (when SAML is disabled, of course).
Ah, if only it were that simple! Instead, to check for an empty string, you need to see if the first byte is zero. Unless it can be `NULL`, I haven't checked whether that's a possibility.
When SSO is on, `prompt` is left uninitialized. You don't actually use it, but it's still passed to `g_free()` when you jump to `out`.

Hi, I just noticed this merge request. What I wrote in !28 still stands: I firmly believe that delegating SAML to the default browser is the right way to go, and that embedding a webview is suboptimal. I'm working to add NetworkManager support for [this PR](https://github.com/adrienverge/openfortivpn/pull/1241).

Hi, our use-case requires that we be able to override the URL that gets passed to the `openfortivpn-webview` process so I've opened !35 which builds on the work done here which otherwise works perfectly for us
